Karnamrta Krishna Dasa
Karnamrta Krishna Dasa
postsData.content:
Simple living is a virtue lauded by thinkers since time immemorial. This virtue was mocked as primitive with the spread of the modern culture of lifestyle products, wherein people equated possession of state-of-the-art luxuries with success. While wealth has always been flaunted as a marker of success, most modern luxuries were unprecedented in the ecological destruction that went into making them.

Consequently, simplicity seems to have made a comeback of sorts, at least among environmentally conscious people. Two centuries of untrammelled industrialization and unfettered commercialization have devastated our ecosystem, thereby making a movement towards simplicity not just desirable but even essential. Simplicity offers the joys of calmness and clarity that come about when we are not constantly titillated by myriad sensual stimulations.

However, given the overall materialism of our age, many still believe that gratifying the senses is lifeâ€™s prime necessity (Bhagavad-gita 16.11). For them, decreasing luxuries seems like an appallingly anti-progressive idea. Without constant sensual stimulation, they feel utterly bored, as if they have nothing to live for. Thatâ€™s why, despite nominally acknowledging the importance of simplicity, many people prefer luxury for themselves whenever they can get it.

postsData.content:
BIOMIMICRY CONTINUUM â€“ Part 5 â€“ CURATING Agentic Expertise
Multidisciplinary expertise is critical to correctly define the key premises driving problem analysis and solution architecture, and the Agentic Expertise Ecosystem (left image) enables capturing that expertise as a reusable computing asset.

The current AI chaos is due to 70 years of narrow and unexamined premises. The promise of AGI in the 1950s was rooted in premises that have been disproven by real-world evidence but blindly adhered to by those making todayâ€™s AGI claims. Key examples:

-Premise: language is the source of intelligence
-Reality: intelligence is the source of language - babies are intelligent before they can speak

-Premise: data is a representation of the real world
-Reality: data is the output of a machine and represents only what the machine was designed to capture

-Premise: the brain constructs objects by identifying frequent patterns of object bits
-Reality: the brain contains networks of abstract concept cells which fire when the concepts are presented in diverse versions and formats (text, image, sound, etc.)

-Premise: neural networks imitate how the brain reasons by processing massive data exhaustively
-Reality: the brain computes the relevance of inputs using inhibition networks, filtering out over 99.99% of sensory data

There are more, but the point is that the main objectives of curation are:
1-Ensure that knowledge from all relevant domains is included in the ontology
2-Map the relevant knowledge concepts across the domains to problem and solution concepts
3-Maintain the landscape concepts (science, business, regulation, etc.) reasonably updated

To enable these objectives, the custodian systems must support:
1-Biomimetic digital twinning of problem and solution concepts
2-Independent update by authorized experts
2-Simulation and testing of the impact of proposed updates across the ontology architecture

The methodology and technology to build this type of biomimetic digital twin ecosystem exist, we have produced published results, and I have discussed this in my posts.

The vision of the Agentic Expertise Ecosystem in the image, however, is in early stages and will require committed partners with the necessary resources who want to participate in shaping the implementation of this new paradigm.
postsData.commentAdded: Exciting insights! A holistic approach to AGI is crucial. Looking forward to seeing how the Agentic Expertise Ecosystem evolves! #Collaboration

postsData.name:
Adam Boggs
Adam Boggs
postsData.content:
Last week Open AI released â€œOperator,â€ an assistant designed to carry out a wide variety of web tasks that will first be made available for ChatGPT Pro users. As we are exploring different agent models right now at Meahana, I was curious at how well it take a set of instructions and carry out even complex tasks.

After you type in a prompt, it opens up a virtual machine and web browser to get to work.

Experiment 1 - I prompted it "build me a session on the Meahana platform where a group of individuals will brainstorm a list of marketing ideas, then prioritize the top, and build some action items for top ideas." It first searched the internet, found Meahana, asked me for my login (which I took over to enter). Once complete, I was very impressed with how it added three different activities from our template catalog, asking for my validation during the process and even figured out how to configure items to flow from one activity to the next. It handled all of this - getting confused only once. It even added facilitator notes! As a founder, it was fun watching a machine, with no training, try to interpret my instructions and follow the process it takes to build on software we've developed.

Experiment 2 - was a bit of a fail. I prompted "please take this figma mockup of the Meahana landing page, login to my webflow account and create the new page." I assumed this would be more straightforward of a task as it is done everyday. The operator kept searching for prebuilt template layouts, couldn't find what it needed, searched the web for more, gave up, then went back to Webflow to build it from scratch. It looked like a kid banging on a piano, just adding random div blocks, formatting and unformatting them, styling and unstyling text. After 30 minutes of watching it adding and deleting ideas, I finally gave up watching.

I know Operator (computer using agent) is best suited to do simple internet tasks, but its fun to see the possibilities. The AI agent technology that is being built at companies, including ours, will be trained on performing smaller sets of tasks across several specialized agents.

Has anyone else experimented with Operator yet?
postsData.commentAdded: Fascinating insights on OpenAIs Operator! Itâ€™s impressive how it tackled complex tasks but shows the limits of AI in creative processes. Excited for future developments!

Achievement unlocked: Dry January. And wow, it was a January to be dry in the world of social media.

I wouldnâ€™t classify myself as a big drinker in terms of frequency or volume these days.

Iâ€™m in my late 30s, I have 2 businesses, and 2 young kids. My big nights out are out are long gone.

But like all people, sometimes I have a day. Or in the case of January, an unrelenting torrent of bullsh*t from the biggest social media platforms in the world. Platform shutdowns, political panic, sudden metric deprecations, and APIs just plain not working.

And after one of those days, well, . All better.

I think the biggest thing Iâ€™ve learned in my relationship with alcohol is it shrinks my battery. And I need that energy tomorrow (I mentioned the small kids, right?).

In terms of the result, I feel great!

Noticable differences:

 Better sleep. I average 6 hours. Itâ€™s not enough. Making that better quality 1-2 nights a week is huge for me.

 Less inflammation, especially in my hands. I type all day, family history of arthritis, and it was single digit low temperatures in Philadelphia much of January.

ï¸ Lost some water weight. Down 6 lbs on the scale. I donâ€™t notice a difference, but my wife says my face isnâ€™t as puffy, so Iâ€™ll take the W.

 Iâ€™m thinking about alcohol less. Not that it preoccupied my thoughts, but at the end of a long day I find myself reflexively thinking more about the frozen grapes in the freezer or squeezing in some Call of Duty after the kids go to bed.

Iâ€™m not a teetotaler, do your thing! But it was a great exercise and I highly recommend it.

As for me, Iâ€™m downgrading to special occasions.

Cheers to health!

postsData.content:
BIOMIMICRY CONTINUUM â€“ Part 5 â€“ CURATING Agentic Expertise
Multidisciplinary expertise is critical to correctly define the key premises driving problem analysis and solution architecture, and the Agentic Expertise Ecosystem (left image) enables capturing that expertise as a reusable computing asset.

The current AI chaos is due to 70 years of narrow and unexamined premises. The promise of AGI in the 1950s was rooted in premises that have been disproven by real-world evidence but blindly adhered to by those making todayâ€™s AGI claims. Key examples:

-Premise: language is the source of intelligence
-Reality: intelligence is the source of language - babies are intelligent before they can speak

-Premise: data is a representation of the real world
-Reality: data is the output of a machine and represents only what the machine was designed to capture

-Premise: the brain constructs objects by identifying frequent patterns of object bits
-Reality: the brain contains networks of abstract concept cells which fire when the concepts are presented in diverse versions and formats (text, image, sound, etc.)

-Premise: neural networks imitate how the brain reasons by processing massive data exhaustively
-Reality: the brain computes the relevance of inputs using inhibition networks, filtering out over 99.99% of sensory data

There are more, but the point is that the main objectives of curation are:
1-Ensure that knowledge from all relevant domains is included in the ontology
2-Map the relevant knowledge concepts across the domains to problem and solution concepts
3-Maintain the landscape concepts (science, business, regulation, etc.) reasonably updated

To enable these objectives, the custodian systems must support:
1-Biomimetic digital twinning of problem and solution concepts
2-Independent update by authorized experts
2-Simulation and testing of the impact of proposed updates across the ontology architecture

The methodology and technology to build this type of biomimetic digital twin ecosystem exist, we have produced published results, and I have discussed this in my posts.

The vision of the Agentic Expertise Ecosystem in the image, however, is in early stages and will require committed partners with the necessary resources who want to participate in shaping the implementation of this new paradigm.
postsData.commentAdded: Fascinating insights! Embracing multidisciplinary expertise is key to advancing AGI. Excited to see how the Agentic Expertise Ecosystem evolves!

Security vs. Privacy in the Age of Anti-Drone Systems 

The Rise of Anti-Drone Technology: Navigating Privacy Concerns and Emerging Trends 

The anti-drone industry is experiencing rapid growth, driven by increasing concerns about privacy violations, security threats, and the potential for disruption from unauthorized drones. As this technology evolves, navigating the complex interplay between security needs and individual privacy rights is crucial.

ï¸ Key Trends Shaping the Anti-Drone Landscape:

1. Focus on Non-Kinetic Solutions: The industry is moving beyond traditional methods like jamming towards more sophisticated solutions that minimize interference with other electronic devices. This includes technologies like directed energy systems, net guns, and AI-powered detection
2. Emphasis on Privacy and Data Security: Concerns about privacy violations are paramount. Companies are developing and implementing technologies that prioritize data security and minimize the impact on legitimate drone operators.
3. Integration with Existing Security Systems: Anti-drone systems are increasingly being integrated with existing security infrastructures, such as CCTV systems, access control systems, and perimeter security measures, to create a more comprehensive
4. Advancements in AI and Machine Learning: AI and machine learning are playing an increasingly. Anti-drone systems. These technologies enable faster and more accurate detection, classification, and response to drone threats.
5. The Rise of Counter-UAS (C-UAS) as a Service: The emergence of C-UAS-as-a-Service models is providing organizations with flexible and cost-effective access to advanced anti-drone technology. This allows businesses and government agencies

 Challenges and Considerations:

1. Balancing Security with Privacy: Striking the right balance between security needs and individual privacy rights is a critical challenge. Anti-drone systems must be designed and deployed responsibly to minimize the impact on legitimate drone operations and protect individual freedoms.
2. Regulatory Landscape: The regulatory landscape surrounding drone technology is constantly evolving. Companies must stay abreast of relevant regulations and ensure their solutions comply with all applicable laws and standards.
3. Ethical Considerations: The ethical implications of deploying anti-drone technologies must be carefully considered. It's crucial to ensure that these systems are used responsibly and ethically, avoiding unintended consequences.

The anti-drone industry is poised for significant growth in the coming years, driven by evolving threats and increasing demand for effective countermeasures. Share your insights below

postsData.content:
ANALYSIS OF THE FEATURES OF TURKISH ACCENTED ENGLISH AND ITS COMPREHENSIBILITY

Authors
Vefa TÃ¼reli
Keywords: General American English, Istanbul Turkish, phonology, Levenshtein algorithm
Abstract
While contributing to diversity in language, accents make comprehension harder for L1 and L2 speakers. This is caused by non-native speakers pronouncing said languageâ€™s phonemes different in a way thatâ€™s rooted in the non-native speakerâ€™ languagesâ€™ cross-language phonetic differences. This study aims to describe phenomena like these that occur with native Turkish speakersâ€™ pronunciation of English. The study was conducted with Turkish high-schoolers who had completed a preparatory year in English. They were asked to read 2 texts and a list of words while being recorded, these recordings were transcribed using the IPA and compared with the General American accented counterparts using the Levenshtein algorithm. Volunteer American high-schoolers in southern United States listened to and were surveyed about the recordings. The comprehension survey yielded results agreeing with the previous claims on the accentâ€™s properties. As for the comprehensibility of Turkish-accented English, the answers claimed the accent to be mainly comprehensible.
postsData.commentAdded: Fascinating study, Vefa! It highlights the importance of understanding accents in enhancing cross-cultural communication and teaching methodologies.

postsData.content:
BIOMIMICRY CONTINUUM â€“ Part 5 â€“ CURATING Agentic Expertise
Multidisciplinary expertise is critical to correctly define the key premises driving problem analysis and solution architecture, and the Agentic Expertise Ecosystem (left image) enables capturing that expertise as a reusable computing asset.

The current AI chaos is due to 70 years of narrow and unexamined premises. The promise of AGI in the 1950s was rooted in premises that have been disproven by real-world evidence but blindly adhered to by those making todayâ€™s AGI claims. Key examples:

-Premise: language is the source of intelligence
-Reality: intelligence is the source of language - babies are intelligent before they can speak

-Premise: data is a representation of the real world
-Reality: data is the output of a machine and represents only what the machine was designed to capture

-Premise: the brain constructs objects by identifying frequent patterns of object bits
-Reality: the brain contains networks of abstract concept cells which fire when the concepts are presented in diverse versions and formats (text, image, sound, etc.)

-Premise: neural networks imitate how the brain reasons by processing massive data exhaustively
-Reality: the brain computes the relevance of inputs using inhibition networks, filtering out over 99.99% of sensory data

There are more, but the point is that the main objectives of curation are:
1-Ensure that knowledge from all relevant domains is included in the ontology
2-Map the relevant knowledge concepts across the domains to problem and solution concepts
3-Maintain the landscape concepts (science, business, regulation, etc.) reasonably updated

To enable these objectives, the custodian systems must support:
1-Biomimetic digital twinning of problem and solution concepts
2-Independent update by authorized experts
2-Simulation and testing of the impact of proposed updates across the ontology architecture

The methodology and technology to build this type of biomimetic digital twin ecosystem exist, we have produced published results, and I have discussed this in my posts.

The vision of the Agentic Expertise Ecosystem in the image, however, is in early stages and will require committed partners with the necessary resources who want to participate in shaping the implementation of this new paradigm.
postsData.commentAdded: Incredible insights! Embracing multidisciplinary expertise is vital for transforming AI. Excited to see how the Agentic Expertise Ecosystem evolves!
